item.title: Building a Second Brain
Sprint 01 - Google Sheets
item.description: 101 https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/12VwFWMDe62RJ-NxfmtGrd_9RM7y7Bk5rByqfrGpeE5o/edit?usp=sharing Why use google sheets Storage Structured data / Tabular data Analyze Present Manually Input Data Numbers align right by default Text align left by default Format date Array input ={1, 2, 3, 4, 5} -> 1 Row (A1 -> E1) ={1, 2; 3, 4; 5, 6} -> 3 Rows (A1 -> B1, A2 -> B2, A3 -> B3) Should have same number of elements in each row Cell References Shortcut key : F4 / fn + F4 (Switch relative & absolute reference mode) A1 : No fix $A1 : Fix col A A$1 : Fix row 1 $A$1 : Fix both row & col Functions FUNCTION_NAME(arg1, arg2, [arg3], [arg4]) arg 3 & 4 are optional Read help & documentation YEAR() / MONTH() / DAY() If & Array Instead of creating one cell and drag down, wrap with ArrayFormula (Ctrl/⌘+Shift+Enter) IF(logical_expression, value_if_true, value_if_false) Nested IF & IFS `IFS(cond1, val1, cond2, val2, …, condN, valN) Can use TRUE for “else” Use Alt + Enter to format code in multiple lines AND, OR, NOT AND(exp1, exp2, .

item.title: 24 Dec 2022 - Building a Second Brain
item.description: The power of writing things down + The power of sharing Recent blog post Choice Architecture Sweet spot between “What you love (and write)”, and “What you share to the world” “Your mind is for having ideas, not holding them.

item.title: 17 Dec 2022 - Intro to Bootcamp
item.description: 5 Awesome Books 2 Rules: Skills in combination are more powerful than individual skills Generalist > Specialist Never go beyond 80% Diminishing return Learning Sprint
